image.altText: A concept image of the proposed Hobart stadium at Macquarie Poi nt.

props.synopsis: The $240 million in Commonwealth funding for the Macquarie Point stadium and precinct will now be exempt from Tasmania's GST calculations, leaving more money for the state and ending a months-long war of words.

title.children: Parties line up to claim credit over federal Hobart stadium funding GST backflip

image.altText: Gregory Geason wearing a blue suit with bus in background

props.synopsis: Former Tasmanian Supreme Court judge Gregory Geason pleaded guilty in a NSW court to one count of contravening a restriction specified in an AVO.

title.children: Former Supreme Court judge sentenced after breaching domestic violence order

image.altText: Spirit of Tasmania new ferry funnel lifted by cranes into place.

props.synopsis: The fit-outs for the new Spirit ferries were initially pledged to include up to $100 million in "Tasmanian local content", but the state government says that now includes Australia-wide businesses and big multinationals.

title.children: Apple and other multinationals counted as 'local content' for new Spirit ferries fit-out

image.altText: A helicopter view of Robert Greig's ute on fire in the middle of a forest.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian father says he now accepts police played no role in the death of his fugitive son in 2022 â€” with an inquest hearing the theory originated with the operator of a Facebook news page.

title.children: Father tells inquest he accepts police had no involvement in son's death

image.altText: A man with a cropped beard and glasses stands outside a school building.

props.synopsis: A former principal in Tasmania is sentenced to a home detention order over the persistent sexual abuse of a student in the 1980s.

title.children: Former Tasmanian principal sentenced to home detention for sexual abuse of student

image.altText: A grey-haired man stands in front of red and black books on a bookshelf.

props.synopsis: A member of Tasmania's judiciary has written to the Attorney-General over the recent appointment of the state's next chief justice, saying he is "so dismayed" by the selection he "cannot remain silent".

title.children: Member of Tasmanian judiciary's 'dismay' over chief justice hire

image.altText: A chain of mostly transparent bioluminescent organisms glowing blue

props.synopsis: While they may not look like it, salps are more closely related to humans than they are to jellyfish. The extraordinary numbers of them accumulating at Tasmanian beaches have delighted biologists.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ What are 'salps', the jellyfish-like creatures invading Tasmanian beaches?

image.altText: Japanese macaques in an enclosure.

props.synopsis: Launceston City Council has voted to sterilise the popular troop of macaque monkeys living in City Park as they are becoming inbred.

title.children: Tasmanian council decides to let beloved City Park monkeys die out

image.altText: Children and women gather around the remnants of a burnt out truck.

props.synopsis: Pakistan's government denies the shooting deaths reported by ousted leader Imran Khan's party, while journalists on the ground reveal the roadblocks they've faced trying to uncover the true death toll.

title.children: As Imran Khan mourns, Pakistan government denies protest deaths

image.altText: alleged false cancer victim

props.synopsis: SA Police allege the man and woman shaved their six-year-old boy's head and eyebrows, put the child in a wheelchair and applied bandages to make it look like the child had received radiotherapy.

title.children: Parents who allegedly shaved son's head and received $60,000 in donations for fake cancer treatment arrested

image.altText: Sliding glass doors into a building with the words Reserve Bank of Australia written above.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank has highlighted scenarios where it might consider both cutting and hiking interest rates. The RBA's chief economist Sarah Hunter used a speech to show how the bank deals with an uncertain macroeconomic environment.

title.children: RBA preparing for all economic scenarios, including a rate hike

image.altText: Two men in suits stand side by side. Trump (right) wears a black MAGA hat.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and his new Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff's new crypto venture has partnered with a crypto platform authorities and experts say has been used by militant groups Hamas and Hezbollah. Â

title.children: Trump's crypto venture partners with platform linked to Middle East militants

image.altText: A line of buildings streching across the shoreline of Beirut.

props.synopsis: As the Syrian dictatorship teetered on the brink, some of Bashar al-Assad's closest confidantes reportedly fled over the border to Lebanon.

title.children: As Assad fled to Russia, his inner circle slipped into luxury Beirut hotels

image.altText: a woman sits on a bench

props.synopsis: Doctors say a health system overhaul is needed to improve the diagnosis and treatment process for ADHD. The federal government says it is supporting the creation of national prescribing rules, an ADHD inquiry recommendation.

title.children: Government commits to national ADHD prescribing rules in inquiry response

image.altText: People wave the flag of the Syrian rebels.

props.synopsis: The collapse of the Assad regime has fragmented Syria's territory, with several armed groups now jostling for control and international players anxious to preserve their regional interests.

title.children: Syria map shows which rebel groups control what now Assad is gone

image.altText: A middle-aged Sri Lankan woman in glasses speaks into a microphone, with a sign reading 'Sri Lanka'

props.synopsis: The worker was paid $11,212 for roughly three years of work as a domestic worker at the Sri Lankan High Commissioner's residence in Canberra.

title.children: Diplomat's employee paid 90c daily wins $117,000 in court

image.altText: A tall red Qantas welcome check-in sign at an airport with a Christmas tree in the background.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Qantas engineers have stopped work for 24 hours at major airports around the country as a long-running pay dispute between the airline an unions threatens to disrupt thousands of travel plans.

title.children: Majority of Qantas flights 'on time' despite strikes by engineers

image.altText: A diagram of the human heart showing the four chambers: two atria at the top, and two ventricles below.

props.synopsis: It's the season for parties and celebrating the end of another year, but having a few too many drinks can come with downsides. Some hangover symptoms might even be a sign of a serious heart condition.

title.children: Racing heart after a big night out? You might have more than a hangover

image.altText: A round, black surveillance camera is pictured to the right of the Chinese flag outside.

props.synopsis: Three men are jailed in Perth for their "crude" attempt to extort money from a Chinese businessman, after torturing him using pliers and a dog collar that emitted electric shocks over a period of more than 50 hours.

title.children: Trio jailed for kidnap and torture of Chinese businessman in Perth

image.altText: Man talking into a microphone at an outdoor press conference in Melbourne

props.synopsis: In its latest budget update, the Victorian government has announced it will increase the levy for emergency services paid by all ratepayers as well as other tax hikes.

title.children: Victorians to be charged extra for emergency services, city parking, EV rego

image.altText: A woman sits in front of a laptop

props.synopsis: A Queensland call centre, currently under investigation by ASIC, has been put into voluntary liquidation. The company denies any wrongdoing.

title.children: 'Super detectives' under investigation by ASIC put into voluntary liquidation

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and a mask looks to the side while walking on the street

props.synopsis: Neil Duncan will spend an extra year behind bars after being found guilty of sexually touching a fourth child victim while on a camping trip in NSW Snowy Mountains.

title.children: Extra jail time for paedophile who abused child on camping trip

image.altText: Dune 2 Recommendations

props.synopsis: Horror once again proves to be the breakthrough in this awards season as Aussie artists scoop multiple nods in the 2025 Critics Choice nominations.

title.children: Critics Choice 2025: The snubs, surprises and successes from the nominations

image.altText: a little robot video game character holds a helmet in a screenshot from a game

props.synopsis: The annual awards ceremony celebrates the year and looks forward to what is coming next in video games â€” as it happened.

title.children: Astro Bot wins Game of the Year at 2024 Game Awards â€” as it happened

image.altText: The white underside of a male humpback whale's tail, framed in black, seen coming out of blue ocean water

props.synopsis: The whale broke migration records by travelling more than 13,000 kilometres over a period of almost a decade.

title.children: Humpback makes record migration between Pacific and Indian oceans

image.altText: The PNG Orchids celebrate a try against Fetu Samoa.

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea is set to enter the NRL in 2028, but the Australian Rugby League Commission will not put a timeline on when a women's team will be established.

title.children: 'We want to make sure they're competitive': PNG NRLW team put on hold

image.altText: An older white man in a suit points as he speaks sternly in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden has commuted the sentences of roughly 1,500 Americans who were released from prison and placed in home confinement during the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as pardoning 39 Americans convicted of nonviolent crimes.

title.children: Biden pardons 39, commutes 1,500 sentences in record act of clemency

image.altText: A large pavlova topped with raspberries, strawberries and dusted with freeze dried raspberries. On an outdoor table.

props.synopsis: From a stunning pavlova topped with red berries to a simple and delicious glazed ham, weâ€™ve collected all our best Christmas recipes in one place.

title.children: Glazed ham, pavlova and summery trifle: Our 12 best Christmas recipes

image.altText: A still from an animated film showing armed figures on horseback silhouetted by a large glowing full moon

props.synopsis: The new film tells the story of an attack on the people of Rohan, pulled from Tolkien's writing. But they've added a brand-new character.

title.children: Lord of the Rings, but make it anime: The War of the Rohirrim is here

image.altText: Jin Woodman

props.synopsis: At only 15, Jin Woodman has earned a wildcard to the Open's main draw at Melbourne Park after winning three titles at the 2024 Australian Wheelchair Tennis National Championships and climbing to number 20 in the world.Â

title.children: 'Dylan Alcott effect': Rising teen tennis star to make Australian Open debut

image.altText: An Asian elephant in a crate before moving from Perth to Adelaide.

props.synopsis: One of Perth Zoo's beloved elephants will depart for a new home in South Australia much sooner than originally planned, with keepers now convinced the female should be moved next month.

title.children: Elephant 'in desperate need of company' set for early safari park move

image.altText: A photo of a pair of hands holding a basket with coffee cherries in it.

props.synopsis: Righto then smarty pants, test yourself.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Parcel poaching, coffee prices soaring and a new NRL team for PNG

props.synopsis: In celebration of his final day on the News Breakfast couch.Â

title.children: A look back at Michael Rowland's best moments on News Breakfast
